page.title: 09Locks On The River Weaver
page.content: The transport on the River Weaver need to use Vale Royal Locks. The River Weaver has been important in transporting goods especially salt. Up until 1721AD the river was difficult to navigate. The big lock was built in 1889. The small in 1860. There is very little traffic mainly for recreation. The lock keeper who lives near the locks is a bank walker. He helps people use the locks. He works full-time maintaining the locks. He is employedby the British Waterway Board. The surrounding wildlife is intresting and includes stoats, rabbits, hares, weasles and a variety of water and garden birds. The fish caught include bream, roach, tench, carp, eel and pike. The railway line passing Moulton was the first one to be opened in Cheshire it was built around 1883 and called the Grand Junction.
